definition: to sell out/to run out (of supplies)/deficient/lack of supplies
to shed/to take off/to escape/to get away from
to melt (metal)/to cancel or annul/to sell/to spend/to fasten with a bolt/bolt or pin

sentences.english: By virtue of its super quality ,this product is often sold out in many areas.
sentences.chinese: 由于品质卓越，这款商品经常在一些地区脱销。

sentences.english: I'm sorry, toasters are out of stock.
sentences.chinese: 对不起，烤面包器已脱销了。

sentences.english: Many stores have run out of Zhu Zhus, increasing the urgency that parents feel.
sentences.chinese: 许多商店已经脱销了，这增加了父母的紧迫感。

sentences.english: The Benz cars are out of stock.
sentences.chinese: 奔驰牌的车已经脱销了。

sentences.english: The reason is that the product you need has been out of stock.
sentences.chinese: 其原因是，此货品在我处已经脱销。

sentences.english: We all know that Chinese slippers are very popular in your market since they have superior quality and competitive prices.
sentences.chinese: 我们都知道中国拖鞋因价廉物美而脱销于你方市场。

sentences.english: Mr. Beaver's Woodchopper kits selling out in droves.
sentences.chinese: 海狸先生木偶配套用品在人群中脱销一空。

sentences.english: The Benz beds are out of stock.
sentences.chinese: 奔驰牌的床已经脱销了。

sentences.english: Mr. Beaver, Woodchopper, keeps selling out in droves.
sentences.chinese: 海狸先生，伐木者，正持续大批脱销。

definition: to sell strongly/to be in great demand
to buy frenetically/to snap up (bargains, dwindling supplies etc)
to be completely sold out/to sell out
to sell/to betray/to spare no effort/to show off or flaunt
to win instant success (idiom)/to start off successfully
